comment.author: 26220432@N06
comment._content:
** translation of describtion **

Second World War, occupation. A Peel-collector (not sure if there is a proper translation for this trade) at the cattlemarket in Utrecht is searching for bones in the peel in the back of a truck so he can bring them to the gluefactory.
Holland, Utrecht, March 21th 1941.

comment.author: 29998366@N02
comment._content:
Hartelijk dank. We zijn bezig met het verwerken van de reactie(s), ook op onze beeldbank.
Hains Hamelink, Spaarnestad Photo (partner Nationaal Archief)

comment.author: 99646216@N00
comment._content: I looked up Schillenboer because I had no idea what a "peel collector" was - it's someone who collects fruit and vegetable peels for use as animal fodder. In English this would be called "swill" - usually fed to pigs. So the closest would probably be "swill collector".

comment.author: 87805257@N00
comment._content:
Mijn eigene vertaling (naar het Fraans)

Durant l'occupation de la 2eme guerre mondiale. 
Un ouvrier cherche et récupère, des os et des peaux de boeufs à l'arrière d'un camion du marché aux bestiaux à Utrecht. Il ira les amener à l'usine de colle.
